page.title: 18COMMUTER VIEW OF COPFORD
page.content: { Copford}is not one of the most attractive of our Essex villages nor is it exactly a composite one. It has that rather straggly but kempt appearance which to the fleeting visitor is not always readily discernable. It divides into three main catchment areas. Busy London Road with its through traffic and "Windmill" nightspot; School Road aptly named leading us past the recently erected Village sign to the Green, the quieter corner which includes our village 'local', The Alma, a bustling country hostelry beside the Green overlooking the old dutch barn and village pond, is perhaps the only{refuge}apart from our Church and Primary school where all three communities unite.
